snippet: The government’s recent gains have diminished pressure on President Bashar al-Assad to compromise in negotiations.
abstract: Russian air support enables Syrian government forces to encircle rebels holding crucial commercial city of Aleppo; Saudi Arabia suggests it would deploy ground forces alongside American troops fighting Islamic State in Syria; conflict, which has devolved into proxy war among regional powers, prompted United Nations to suspend peace talks.

byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The government’s recent gains have diminished pressure on President Bashar al-Assad to compromise in negotiations.

headline.main: Government Forces, Backed by Russian Jets, Advance in Syria
headline.print_headline: Saudis Suggest U.S. Allies Join for Syria Ground Operation

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
